subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Which lexical set is the second vowel of _because_ in?
msgSnippet: ... True but not relevant here.  No matter how much I stress the words of and from (as in the phrase of but not from , where they have contrastive
messageBody:
Benct Philip Jonsson scripsit:

> But surely any 'low-content' with a vowel frem the 'checked' group (KIT,
> DRESS, TRAP, FOOT, STRUT, LOT) can get a de-stressed form with schwa?
> And surely these words should be spellad as if stressed even when
> they aren't?

True but not relevant here. No matter how much I stress the words
"of" and "from" (as in the phrase "of but not from", where they have
contrastive stress), the vowel remains /V/ and never becomes /A/, which
means that they belong to STRUT and not LOT for me. Not all words are
absolutely invariant as to lexical set.

> both _him_ and _them_ can become /Vm/ when fully unstressed,

The /@m/ pronunciation of the latter is not a reduction but a
separate lexeme < OE _hem_.

--
John Cowan http://www.ccil.org/~cowan cowan@...
Uneasy lies the head that wears the Editor's hat! --Eddie Foirbeis Climo
